intro: Thlaspi subulatum, commonly known as Arctic mouse-ear or winter mouse-ear, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. This plant is typically found in alpine and arctic regions, thriving in rocky or sandy soils. It is well adapted to cold climates and can survive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments. Thlaspi subulatum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
